ActFinancial Administration Act
SubjectAggregate borrowing limit
PrecisOrder (1) authorizing the Minister of Finance to borrow money on behalf of the Government of Canada and conducting activities related to the borrowing of money as he considers appropriate; (2) specifying $300 BILLION AS THE AGGREGATE PRINCIPAL AMOUNT OF MONEY THAT THE MINISTER OF FINANCE MAY BORROW in the period beginning on April 1, 2018 and ending on March 31, 2019; (3) designating which officials within the Department of Finance and the Bank of Canada who can sign and countersign security certificates; (4) authorizing the Minister of Finance to appoint fiscal agents and registrars for example for any foreign currency debt issued by Canada in the 2018-19 fiscal year; and (5) authorizing payments out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund for the management of the public debt.
